intro: Psychotria heterocephala, commonly known as the "Heterocephala Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. The species is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological systems.
